job_description:
Our client, marketing + brand consultant for Fortune 500 companies across a variety of industries, is dedicated to shifting culture within the businesses they coach.

This Director of Partnerships role will be responsible for building strategic partnerships with high profile companies. In this role you would manage all aspects within the partnership and work closely with both internal and external stakeholders. This is an exciting opportunity to participate in dynamic, impactful mission-driven work to achieve social impact.
• Managing partnerships by researching industry leaders, organizations, and content creators across diverse sectors (Beauty, Toys, Media, etc.) for impactful campaigns and social initiatives
• Coordinate outreach to potential partners
• Lead the execution of sponsorship contracts, presentations, and proposals from partners
• Collaborate with the client or brand team on partnership deliverables.
• Manage the partnership tracker and handle inbound partner calls
• Act as a key liaison with external and internal stakeholders
• Develop and oversee the overall strategy for partnerships with clients
• Monitor key impact deliverables for each partnership.
• Generate clear, data-driven decks or reports outlining impact work for each program.
• Provide guidance on industry best practices for measuring impact

Requirements
• Exceptional emotional intelligence
• Proven business acumen and strong relationship-building experience
• Meticulous attention to detail
• Genuine passion for social impact programming and cultural issues
• Proven client-facing experience
• Proficient in Google Suite; familiarity with Adobe Suite and Canva is a big plus
• Solutions-driven
• Curious and growth mindset
• A genuine interest in current social issues affecting representation and inclusion in media, marketing, and advertising.

Comp - 110K - 120K DOE

Qualifications: Proven business acumen and strong relationship-building experience
Genuine passion for social impact programming and cultural issues
Proficient in Google Suite; familiarity with Adobe Suite and Canva is a big plus
A genuine interest in current social issues affecting representation and inclusion in media, marketing, and advertising
